newsitem.title: FRANCE: CANAL+ SAYS IN NETHOLD LINK UP.
newsitem.headline: CANAL+ SAYS IN NETHOLD LINK UP.

text.p: French subscriber television station Canal Plus said on Friday it was merging with Nethold, a Dutch satellite television company.
Nethold is joint held by Richemont SA and MCL-Multi-Choice Ltd.
Canal Plus will buy 100 percent of the capital of Nethold from Richemont SA and MIH HOldings Ltd , paying with 6.1 million new Canal Plus shares and $45 million in cash.
Following the issue of new shares, Richemont and MIH will respectively own 15 and five percent of Canal Plus, a statement from the French firm said.
It said the deal was a major strategic move and would create one of the largest television groups in the world, particularly in the field of pay-TV, with over 8.5 million subscribers.
The deal had the support of Canal Plus main shareholders, Havas , Cie Generale de Eaux , Societe Generale , and state bank Caisse des Despots et Consignations, it said.
The merger is subject to regulatory and shareholder approval.
The announcement follows the suspension earlier on Friday on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange of the listings of Richemont Securities AG, MIH and Omni Media Corp Ltd .
The Swiss Stock Exchange also suspended Richemont trading in Zurich, where the company has its primary listing.
The Wall Street Journal earlier said Hughes Electric Corp, a unit of General Motors , was in serious talks to invest as much as $1 billion for a 30-percent stake in NetHold.
MCL-Multi Choice, which recently changed its name to MIH Holdings, is 35-percent owned by Omni Media.
